about.summary: Perform common useful JavaScript operations in Shiny apps that will greatly improve your apps without having to know any JavaScript. Examples include: hiding an element, disabling an input, resetting an input back to its original value, delaying code execution by a few seconds, and many more useful functions for both the end user and the developer. 'shinyjs' can also be used to easily call your own custom JavaScript functions from R.

name: r-shinyjs
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-shinyjs
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: shinyjs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/shinyjs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/shinyjs/shinyjs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 286b11136bc999738592d01f980e7db86930fb3216effc680688829865bc7f84

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1001
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.8
    - r-htmltools >=0.2.9
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-shiny >=1.0.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.8
    - r-htmltools >=0.2.9
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-shiny >=1.0.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('shinyjs')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('shinyjs')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://deanattali.com/shinyjs
  license: AGPL-3
  summary: 'Perform common useful JavaScript operations in Shiny apps that will greatly improve
    your apps without having to know any JavaScript. Examples include: hiding an element,
    disabling an input, resetting an input back to its original value, delaying code
    execution by a few seconds, and many more useful functions for both the end user
    and the developer. ''shinyjs'' can also be used to easily call your own custom JavaScript
    functions from R.'
  license_family: AGPL

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
